text: Hi guys, In my android application I have Relative layout Inflated in mainActivity, I want to add Navigation Drawer to this, SO when I add `android.support.v4.widget.DrawerLayout`  I get run time error as  shown  in attached log file
My issue solved
basically Error is, `java.lang.ClassCastException: android.support.v4.widget.DrawerLayout cannot be cast to android.widget.RelativeLayout`
<@U0E4MGTNY|samryecroft> has joined the channel
<!-- A DrawerLayout is intended to be used as the top-level content view using match_parent for both width and height to consume the full space available. -->
You probably have to put your relativelayout as a child of drawerlayout
Can someone help me with OkHttp?
<https://gist.github.com/petitviolet/b27b61972a6a18ca7b9e>
I'm trying to use this solution to pass callbacks to main thread
However, it still throws NetworkOnMainThread exception on line 34
<@U0E4R68CV|jturolla> has joined the channel
<@U054A24ET>: I solved that problem, by casting it to Relative layout, I changed it View.
I dont know if its correct way but so far nothings wrong with other UI and and my cameraView

<@U0830HE7P>: can you try caching the Handler, a minor optimization but I don't think there is a reason to create a new one every time. Also the exception is normal since you are trying to get data from the `response` while you are in the main thread (since you are using your `runOnUiThread` method). Try this:

```
    @Override
    public void onResponse(final Response response) throws IOException {
        if (!response.isSuccessful() || response.body() == null) {
            onFailure(response.request(), new IOException("Failed"));
            return;
        }
        try {
            String responseBody = response.body().string(); // runs on background
            runOnUiThread(new Runnable() {
            @Override
            public void run() {
                onSuccess(responseBody);  // runs on ui
            }
        });
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
            onFailure(response.request(), new IOException("Failed"));  // runs on ui inside the method
        }
    }
```
<@U09T8SFG8>: Thanks! Seems like moving response reading to background thread worked well! Never thought that this reading may be considered as network operation
No problem :wink:

<@U0830HE7P>: that would have given you a lot of complaints against reading/writing disk on the main thread among a lot of other useful warnings as you commit felonies against â€˜what you should be doing'
change the penalty to crashing if you want to turn on expert mode
its like playing OG contra
